intro: Erycibe albida, commonly known as the white erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Erycibe albida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
